content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 21 Aug 2018What is something you will NEVER invest in? And why?A lot of advice here is what to invest in, but what is it that you would totally avoid?17 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (17)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 21 Aug 2018Anything which people feel a huge FOMO (fear of missing out) towards.​Usually when it's too good to be true, it probably is.0 comments2
Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 21 Aug 2018Personally would avoid cryptocurrency due to it’s high volatility especially with its recent downtrend 0 comments2

Siti PutriLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 21 Aug 2018I will stay away from MLM, land banking, paper gold buyback scheme, IPO and luxury item (bags, watches, arts) reselling.
For IPO, I don't buy as I prefer at least 4+ years track record. Also most IPO prices rather volatile for the first year. 
For luxury items, the the stuff must really be in pristine condition to be able to fetch good price or even breakeven price, plus it is subjective to 'trend', supply/demand or 'perceived value'. Also i will avoid ILP insurance, although granted this is subjected to the choice of funds and long term objective. Just not for me as the fees adds up 0 comments2

Leong Wen Fong, Economics and Management at University of LondonLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 21 Aug 2018I wouldn't say never, but I at the moment, I would not go into cryptocurrency.Reason being I find that I can't really measure trends, and I don't have a lot of information on it.​I'm sure given time, it could become a commonplace currency, and also be more stable in its value. For the moment though, the risk is far too high in my opinion.​The principle for me is never to invest in something you don't understand well enough, how it works, what can cause it to go up and what can cause it to fall, and of course how much it can rise and fall is a factor as well. So just some things to consider before you make any kind of financial commitment as well!0 comments2

Yu EnLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 21 Aug 2018Land banking
Collective gold schemes0 comments2
Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 21 Aug 2018Crypto currency for me. At least not now. 0 comments2

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Durian plantation that was "marketed" by a "social influencer" a while back. And because I hate durians. ​Came across similar talks about investing in plantations, or into wine even. Avoid all these and only go into things you know and have done your own due diligence on.2 comments2

Kenneth Lou21 Aug 2018Hahaha remember that one let me give you the link here (in case someone wants to have a reference): https://mothership.sg/2018/04/influencer-investment-durian-2068/Leong Wen Fong21 Aug 2018Definitely didn't expect this to be an answer to the question hahaha

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Sep 2018Well I will never put my money into any ILPs (investment linked policies) offered by insurance companies. They usually charge heavily for their services. I also believe that I can do better by investing myself :)0 comments1

Aaron TanLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 21 Aug 2018i would never invest in anything that i don't have enough knowledge of.i believe that getting the best deal in town is all about doing enough research, understanding the investment, where the returns come from and the credibility of the sources before taking the plunge.putting the trust on someone is as good as having someone to blame when something goes wrongat this moment, cryptocurrency seems to be too much of a hype and the prices are no longer reflective of its underlying value0 comments1

Jeff Yeo,   amateur Social contributor  at School of social sharingLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Sep 2018Anything that says 10% or more risk free endowment plans wine Investments overseas land investments forest investments 0 comments0

Kenichi Xi, nᴉʍ oʇ dǝnᴉʇsǝd 不能说的秘密 at Tag Team with Gabriel ThamLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Sep 2018Never invest in something you don't understand.eg. Wine, Artwork.​As  for investment vehicle, you need to know how to do the math to look out for an ROI before you can invest.​The Greater Fool's Theory applies but will it applies to you or against you?​Think about it.​​0 comments0

WizardAnswered on 15 Sep 2018Anything that poeple rush you into it or saying will miss a good deal. ​Anything without reasonable logic / fundamentally sound. ​These will all be problematic and not stable and not really investment. 0 comments0

YP OngLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 22 Aug 2018Avoid crowdfunding platforms. They promise high returns up to 18% pa but default rates are high too. Companies which you lend money to are often cashflow strapped and you have a high chance of losing your money.0 comments0
Gabriel ThamLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 15 Sep 2018Avoid MLMAvoid "Get rich quick" scamsAvoid time share​Can try toto/4d but don't invest too much ah....​0 comments0
